meanings.definition: To throw or drop something from a moving vehicle or ship
meanings.sent1: The pirate jettisons the treasure chest overboard.
meanings.sent2: The astronaut jettisons the empty fuel tank into space.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy sailor accidentally jettisons his hat into the ocean.
meanings.sent4: In the movie, the hero jettisons the bomb just in time to save the city.
meanings.sent5: The truck driver jettisons the cargo to lighten the load and drive faster.

meanings.definition: To get rid of something unnecessary or burdensome
meanings.sent1: She jettisons old clothes to make space in her closet.
meanings.sent2: The company jettisons outdated technology to stay competitive.
meanings.sent3: The chef jettisons the burnt dish before anyone notices.
meanings.sent4: He jettisons negative thoughts to focus on positivity.
meanings.sent5: The student jettisons distractions to concentrate on studying.
